content.description:
Source 1St. Auta Altarpiece, Painting by an Unknown Portuguese Artist Completed in Lisbon, Portugal Circa 1520

The painting shows a wedding ceremony between a light-skinned groom and a light-skinned bride.

The groom and bride are both crowned and wearing elaborate, colorful clothing.

A bishop in religious regalia stands before the bride and groom to conduct the ceremony.

The groom and bride are flanked by richly dressed attendants.

In the upper right background, a group of dark-skinned musicians in colorful uniforms play various musical instruments.

Source 2Detail from St. Auta Altarpiece

The detail is a close-up view of the musicians in the upper right corner of the St. Auta Altarpiece painting.

Five musicians wear red and green uniforms with gold hats.Â 

The musicians are playing various types of horns.
Bridgeman Images
content.question: Which of the following statements best explains the significance of this St. Auta Altarpiece painting?

choices.label: The exclusion of African ambassadors from the painting demonstrates the increasing economic isolation of Africa in the sixteenth century.
The musicians in the background indicate that European empires relied heavily on the Atlantic slave trade as a source of plantation labor.
The inclusion of African entertainers provides evidence of how trade increased the presence of Africans in Lisbon.
The wealth depicted in the painting suggests that major trading ports along the Indian Ocean declined as Mediterranean cities like Lisbon flourished.

content.answer: The inclusion of African entertainers provides evidence of how trade increased the presence of Africans in Lisbon.

skill.text: 2.C: Explain the significance of a source's perspective, purpose, context, and audience.
